website_summaries.verdict: This compact, corded chainsaw is lightweight, compact, and easy to put into action trimming small branches.
pros: Administer the right amount of oil to lubricate the push of a button
External tension adjuster helps adjust chain tension.Wraparound handguard for added safety and protection
cons: The chain can sometimes be hard to keep on
Only good for small softwood trees and limbs

website_summaries.verdict: Handles medium-sized trees well and starts well. A decent gas chainsaw from a venerable brand with many die-hard fans.
pros: Value-priced saw that's maneuverable and powerful enough for most users
Good for cutting firewood, trimming trees, and clearing storm debris
cons: Some buyers cite build quality and durability issues

customer_reviews.title: Remington chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chain saw to clear some woodland. I read the reviews and was a little leery about the bad reviews it received but I decided to make the purchase. The larger size of the saw and the engine plus the carrying case were what sold me. I have used this saw all summer and I have not regretted this purchase. I am 76 years old and have no problem starting or using this saw. It starts easy, idles well, and has more than enough power to cut large size trees. It leaks bar oil when put it away but this happens on most chain saws unless you actually drain the oil reservoir. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Not a good investment for the serious chainsaw user
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR: not a good chainsaw for any robust work. Cons: - vapor locked after every use; had to wait until it cooled before it would restart - would not cut straight, perhaps because of the cheap chain that needs frequent sharpening - frequent need to re-tighten/adjust chain - cheap parts Pros: - might be good for the homeowner who needs it for occasional use Conclusion: I bought a Stihl. I wish I had saved the money and done that in the first place. If I could get my money back, I would.
customer_reviews.author: CJReview

customer_reviews.title: Perfect saw for "homeowner plus"
customer_reviews.text: Perfect saw for "homeowner plus". Ran it hard for 6 hours today, clearing trees and limbs that had fallen on our property during recent storms. Easy to use, easy to start. Best part.... filled the tank twice. Great on gas, great on chain oil. Great little saw. I'm coming from a husqvarna that fell apart and would not start. Already this thing paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Started right up and ran strong
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chainsaw. Fired right up on first try, have used it a total of 10 hours maybe more already. Starts up every time with zero issues, cuts fast and strong. I have had alot of chainsaws over the years and I would def. recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Castiglia

customer_reviews.title: Runs great and a great product.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid I am very happy with this saw so far. I have a larger Husky that cost about 3 times as much and this saw keeps right up with it and has more accessories and the case is way better than the Husky that I had to spend an extra $50 bucks or so on (which is a piece of crap). I wish now I had bought 2 of these and saved the money on the Husky. This starts as well or better that the Husky and performs pretty much as well. Anybody want to buy a Husky 450!!!
customer_reviews.author: RTG&T

customer_reviews.title: On off switch does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: Saw works well with the exception of the kill switch (on/off switch) Which does not work at all! This could be a real safety issue. I had to kill motor by pulling choke out, which may in fact not work if motor was not warmed up at the time. I’m curious if this is something I could replace myself and not have to send saw in. I would appreciate any advice from manufacturers. Other than that I would give this saw 5 stars. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the occasional user.
customer_reviews.text: Made sure to read the manual first. Topped up the chain oil, mixed the fuel, checked the chain tension and the brake. All good to start. Even after about 10 pumps to prime the engine and with choke on.. nothing. I left for a few minutes to read the manual making sure i had nothing wrong. Re-primed and 2 pulls in started like a charm. After that first time, everytime. Cut through 8 inch diameter fallen logs like butter. Great chainsaw for the homeowner with a wooded lot and occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Hoodie

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little machine. i own a bushhog by remington and never had a problem so why not give this one a try. It has a smaller tank and its super light compared to a larger one, it will only work with smaller chains. I like it and it is super quick
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dicicco

customer_reviews.title: I like this saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a good saw. I have cut down a half dozen sweet gum trees with it up to 12" diameter. This saw gets the job done. I have used Stihl saws in the past at work and love them, this Remington compares well. I have run six tanks of gas through it so far, starts up every time without issue.
customer_reviews.author: electechJake

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This couldn’t be a better saw for home use. You just need to make sure to turn up the bar oil screw to its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Barrack

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: If you have anything kind of thick look elsewhere it’s for basic thin bushes , it’s light but the plug does keep coming unplugged .
customer_reviews.author: Shane Fradella

customer_reviews.title: Warranty process was time consuming
customer_reviews.text: This saw had to be replaced after about 3, 30 minute sessions over 6 months. Trying to find an authorized repair dealer took several calls and long holds to Remington. The first 4 places they gave me that were in the area did not do warranty repair for Remington. Finally, the fifth place, about 45 minutes from me, took it for a warranty look. They found it was below compression limits. They stated after an hour on the phone with Remington (likely just on hold) they agreed to send a replacement. I'll update this rating depending how this second model performs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Ok definitely not a 500$ stihl but for the money it's great! I have cut down about 5 decent size pines with it so far then cut them all into logs. I use premix fuel in a can that you buy at a store and good bar and chain oil runs great starts after 3-5 pulls.
customer_reviews.author: clutchgeargasgo

customer_reviews.title: it leaks chain oil
customer_reviews.text: I got this about a month ago and finally got a chance to use it to trim some branches in my back yard , started on a first pull with no problems and was easy to use , my problem is its leaking chain oil from the bottom and i can not put it or set it anywhere unless i put a thick rag under it to contain oil , i know i did not over fill it , maybe i have a defected unit , just be aware .
customer_reviews.author: Ugur B Yurder

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this at my job. And compared to the stihl ones we use at work this thing has outperformed various ms250's. Quick and easy start if you simply fallow the instructions. Make sure you are using the correct about of oil in your mix. This runs at 40:1 mix ratio. Chain is still good after 12 trees, 8 green ones and 4 dead trees. Have not sharpened it ones since then. Inspected the chain and the cutting teeth are still in good condition. Co-workers are impressed with it, especially the price.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewGuide

customer_reviews.title: Hard to start
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built, but I'm having trouble getting it to start. I have to pull 10 time's.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Case arrived broken, chainsaw is great!
customer_reviews.text: We had a lot of trouble with the case as 2 arrived cracked and broken. The chainsaw itself was a gift to my son and he loves it. We finally ordered a replacement case by itself, and it arrived in good shape, but it was different that the original 2 that were broken. All is well now.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Ups & downs
customer_reviews.text: Liked the price 💲💲❗ Did not 😒 like the first saw breaking on day 2 of cutting firewood, loosing money. Amazon did me right by sending another saw, same one but different issues. The air filter clogs and chokes the saw. The hole the oil goes through to the bar is so wrong and small it clogs to a point of taking whole saw apart to fix. Never had that problem till Remington.
customer_reviews.author: Kimsluck33

customer_reviews.title: You are taking a chance: beware
customer_reviews.text: As previously mentioned, saw is made in China so beware. Used this saw 3 times and it worked well. On the 4th use the oiler went bad and leaded oil all over the bottom of the case. Remington says my Ace hardware can fix it, but they will not touch it because they can’t get parts out of China. Took it to another repair place and they told me the same thing and said you get what you pay for and recommended Stihl, Husqvarna, or Echo.
customer_reviews.author: rumrunner

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for price, vibration is downside, kickback is bad
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: pluses - good saw for the price, easy to use, started right up; minuses - heavy, vibration that would wear you down after an hour or so of use (no dampners at all between chassis, engine and handle), and the kickback is pretty bad. My 42cc Poulan finally gave up the ghost and I saw this Remington had good reviews. I've never heard of a Remington chainsaw, but couldn't pass on the price. I do light chainsaw work around our 5 acres so don't need anything professional grade.
customer_reviews.author: eph

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but seriously flawed! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Was great at first couple times then dust started bypassing the garbage filter and caking onto the walls of the carb. Cleaned that then the chain oiler started puking oil all over while i was using it. I attempted to adjust the screw and it just went completely loose, like it was threaded into something plastic. Tried to contact Amazon but they just refer me to the manufacturer. I have had it about a month abd used it 6 times lightly total. Not happy at all. I baught new so i didn't have to work on one, doesn't seem to make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: SGT P

customer_reviews.title: Whilst a great saw in usage I am rating this low for ...
customer_reviews.text: Whilst a great saw in usage I am rating this low for two reason 1) the guard design results in damaging chain when it jumps off - 2 new chains and a trip to service center to find this out 2) I bought 4 18’ chains at a store and guess what 18’ or 45cm is two short - per the manual it says it needs to be 46.7 cm ???? So can’t return the chains as I opened container and even the recommended chain on Amazon for this product will be too small! So chains will be hard to find, much more expensI’ve than I expected and will be damaged instantly when it comes off - which will happen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Warren D

customer_reviews.title: The bar that they come with is junk
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw only lasts 5 minutes to me it looks like the bar was bent when I first got it did like the instruction says says run for 15 minutes then tighten chain that first time use I didn't even run it for 5 minutes and the chains came off and will not spend on the bar like it supposed to it just stays locked up
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Marshall

customer_reviews.title: The REMINGTON 14-IN HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: The REMINGTON 42cc14"/35.6cm is One Beautiful Chain Saw. I cut thought 12" to 13" Maple and that hard wood and when dryed out it even harder. It's Built with Craftsmanship. Keep it Clean and Greased and it will Last a Long Time. Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer does not honor warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Not ten minutes into using the chainsaw it hit a knot in the log and the chain came off. This occurred even after pausing frequently to tighten the chain, mandatory on a new chainsaw. The customer service rep for MTD Products gave me two options: return the chainsaw to Amazon or take it to an authorized representative for warranty repair. I chose the latter. After placing the chainsaw on the counter the first words from the manager were "if it's the chain or the bar MTD doesn't approve any claims." It was the chain and I paid out of pocket but really surprised and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G

customer_reviews.title: Very nice budget chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw if you're on a budget and not looking for professional grade equipment. I marked off 1 star because I had a hard time getting it started the first time. Once it finally started, I've had no issues. Also, the chain they give you is not very good. I ordered a Husqvarna 531300439 replacement chain, and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Saw leaks out all of the bar/chain oil each time it's filled - not able to fix
customer_reviews.text: The whole tank of bar/chain oil leaks out due to a flaw in the cast-metal body. I tried to change out the cap to the bar/chain oil tank, and I checked the o-ring on the cap. No luck, it still leaks out the whole tank of oil every time. Nothing like opening the chainsaw case to see it sitting in a 1-2 cup pool of oil. Very poor support from MTD. Otherwise, the saw operates normally... as it should. I wish I'd gone with a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron06

customer_reviews.title: Defective case
customer_reviews.text: The actual chain saw works great. Powerful and does what it should.. The problem is with the case. The clips broke the second time I opened the case, and the inside is cracked. The case never left the dining room table. I have attempted to reach the manufacturer multiple times to replace the case, but no answer by phone or online chat. I understand times are different right now, but I don’t want to miss the window for replacement. If these reviews are monitored, I hope someone will respond with instructions to get this fixed
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Quality lightweight saw
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area and have used many different types and brands of chainsaws for years. This particular saw starts right up and operates flawlessly. Due to the size of this saw I would limit it's use to trimming and clearing small trees . Not quit heavy duty enough to be used for cutting firewood. But just for someone needing a saw to clear fallen limbs from a yard or for clearing ground this is an excellent lightweight saw that seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for money
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself a handy guy. Always borrowed my brothers chainsaw until he moved away. Bought this as a replacement and didn’t want to spend on a husqvarna. This is 100 percent comparable and I don’t say that lightly. Followed instruct on set up and fired up first try, thing was a beast and spent day felling a few trees in back. Would buy again. The storage case was nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Clark

customer_reviews.title: Worked good at first, started leaking bar oil
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and get started, but broke down pretty quickly. It started leaking bar oil probably after 3-4 hours of use (when off). The chainsaw was pretty lightweight though and was easy to get started with. They give you a mix of oil for a gallon of gas, so all you have to buy is your own bar oil and a gallon of fuel to get started!
customer_reviews.author: Dettmanm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start.  Great power.  Lowe Vibration
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw. It is super easy to start and operate. It has plenty of power to cut up to medium logs with ease. Love the brand. This is my second one.
customer_reviews.author: James Gaskill

customer_reviews.title: Properly tensioned chain fell off after 1-2 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: Saw is heavy, but seemed to be built fairly well for the price. The 3-4 2"-4" cut with it went pretty smoothly. Properly tensioned chain fell off after 1-2 minutes of use. Reinstalled chain and several chain dive links were gnarled/swollen to the point of not being able to slide in the bar. 20 minute wait time on a Saturday to get to a customer service agent. In Fort Worth, Texas there couple nearby authorized service centers, but none will be open until Monday and there are no other options to get this resolved in order to be able to use my saw this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Damn good Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so impressed with this saw! 10X better then that new Sthil I bought! Fires up and keeps on a running!
customer_reviews.author: Patti-lu Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Owesome chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Good quality chainsaw, cut a 30ft palm tree in front of our house, just like butter. Only thing that I noticed, its a little bit heavy but for the price, its still 5 stars for me. Fast shipping, very good seller, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 20min. Cool 3hr. Works 20min.
customer_reviews.text: It works for 20min. Then needs to cool down for 2 hours before I can get it started again... Great chainsaw for price, only if you don't need it for more than 20min. At a time...
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: So glad I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older, battery powered saw that leaked oil, and wasn't too powerful. Luckily, my friend borrowed it, for 3+ months, and I picked up this gas powered saw. Cutting firewood is now a breeze! The case keeps everything secure, and the saw is easy to maintain. I should have done this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bob L. Desilets Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Anything that is gas powered that it can be hard to start but other than that it works well just be careful and safe
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Set up was easy and it has been running smoothly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an emergency or to cut down small branches. If feels and sturdy!. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Heredia

customer_reviews.title: Decent Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: For the price its great, The only problem I have though is getting this chainsaw to start cold, and bar chain oil leaks, it is a pain. Once it runs though, it performs well, I've used it to cut Pine and Oak Trees and it cuts great. I would recommend for homeowners.
customer_reviews.author: Kasel

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like a champ. 4 stars cause it’s a little hard to start when hot, starts easy when cold if you follow instructions. Good cheap saw case isn’t bad either
customer_reviews.author: SK16117

customer_reviews.title: butter
customer_reviews.text: Little heavy, but for this price I think it works great. Now I only use it like 3 times a year but for those uses it worked as well as my buddy's Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Yokum

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Used once and very impressed with how smooth it cuts and handles big tree trunk into logs. If it continues to work as it did its top notch
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Plus is that it starts up easy. Negative is that the chain falls off and it is hard to put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Cf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with nice safety features!
customer_reviews.text: Husband was very pleased with the price and efficiency of the chain saw. Not bulky, very lightweight and works well for the kinds of cleanup jobs needed in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia WIlliams

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a logger
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a logger, but it seems to be a good chainsaw. Fairly lightweight. Used it a couple of times and it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Yu

customer_reviews.title: The worst I have seen.
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this product. This is the second one I bought. It overheats. Oil system does not work as it should on this machine. Same problem in both. One is burned, the other one I gave it away. I never buy this machines again, and you shouldn't. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: maynord claros

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Item completely fell apart while cutting. Junk. Chain will not tighten back onto bar. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with chain oil
customer_reviews.text: Apparently the people at Remington or Amazon dont know the difference between chain oil and engine oil, item did not come as advertised with bar and chain oil, came with 3 oz bottle of 2 cycle engine oil...fix it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: works for me, does what its supposed to do for me. cuts like a charm, im no lumberjack, but i`m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gene P

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Trash, broke the second time I used it , leaks oil and chain will not tighten, amazon will not do anything for me. DONT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: As a women with limited strength ,I chose this saw after being frustrated with battery powered saws,this is what I was looking for,,powerful and light weight, ,easy start,,very very pleased
customer_reviews.author: david a.

customer_reviews.title: Just average use.
customer_reviews.text: It's seems just average. Works fine. Just thought based off of the reviews it would a little more impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: POS from start up.
customer_reviews.text: Saw wont start after its turned off. Wtf? I just got it an hour ago and twice it wont start for me. I will never again purchase another remington power tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Great chain, easy adjustments and starts right up. Well built. For the $$ just "do it"
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Great saw bad safety.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have cut down two big trees with no problems. Why 3 Star rating? The on /off button doesnt work. So if I want to turn it off, I have to flood it by pulling the choke out to shut it down. BIG SAFETY ISSUE!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: saw case
customer_reviews.text: Stay upset because the saw came in a broken suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Derevyanko

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Fired up as per instructions printed on top of saw. Cut through 12" logs like butter. Very impressed with first time performance.
customer_reviews.author: Home remodeler

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality saw!
customer_reviews.text: This will be the third chainsaw I own including a Stihl and Echo.. and all I can saw is wow! Id definitely recommend this saw over a $350 “name brand” any day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris mayne

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw
customer_reviews.text: Ran it for the first time yesterday, started without a problem. It does run out of gas pretty quick but for the price it seems to be a good value
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage, the thing lasted 6 months, chopped about 10 trees and will not stay running, oil plug cap is another cheap make that leaks everywhere in the case that fell apart already...cheap slap together buy a Stilh......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a beast . The parts don't look cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Jones

customer_reviews.title: came with all the necessities
customer_reviews.text: awesome saw came with a nice case fast delivery and works wonders!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: It runs great and handles well
customer_reviews.text: It has an oil leak and will need to take it into a shop to see if it can be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta L. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clean up big limbs from storm damage. Worked great. Follow directions and it starts easy.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Greatest bang for your buck for home owners who occasionally will use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to start great power anti vibe handle keeps you from getting fatigued cut effortlessly
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Chain oil was not in the case, I did get gas oil.
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive the chain oil in the case. I have not run the chain saw yet, because I need to go and get chain oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT BAD
customer_reviews.text: TO INCLUDE A SHARPENING FILE WOULD BE HELPFUL / HEAVY DUTY CASE IS GOOD / ALL THE BRANDS ARE USING TOO MUCH BREAKABLE PLASTIC COVERS , CAPS...RUNS GOOD...
customer_reviews.author: gt chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Best chainsaw I have used!
customer_reviews.text: Cut down about 40 trees, no issues or problems. Only sharpened chain. Second season, started on second pull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal good product
customer_reviews.text: This is very good for the price and done a great job
customer_reviews.author: Patricia W.

customer_reviews.title: My fellow loved this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my boyfriend and he loved how light and easy it was.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw/crappy delivery
customer_reviews.text: If it wasnt for the broken chainsaw carrying case it would have got 5 star but atleast its on bottom i guess so it want get wet. UPS just sucks though they do not care about your stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: case is crap
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw ran fine, but like other respondents, the case is crap. The sides were broken with pieces missing and the latches were unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bolmgren

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Quality machine don’t worry about electrical problems it’s covered in the warranty
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Franklin

customer_reviews.title: A1
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box. Just follow easy start directions. Cut up a 100' tree that came down in a storm. Started it many times, never a problem. Have had more powerful saws, but this is a great saw for the money. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived. Will return later to write post. ...
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived. Will return later to write post. Case did not come with a carrying handle. Called Remington, aka MTD Machines, and, advised that I return whole thing and get a new one. So, I will adjust later.
customer_reviews.author: C. Callahan

product_meta.title: Remington RM4618 Outlaw 46cc 2-Cycle 18-Inch Gas Powered Chainsaw with Carrying Case Automatic Chain Oiler and 5-Point Anti Vibration System, 46 cc-18, Orange
product_meta.description: Remington RM4618 Outlaw 46cc 2-Cycle 18-Inch Gas Powered Chainsaw with Heavy Duty Carrying Case, QuickStart, 5-Point Anti Vibration System and Tool-Free Access is engineered with advanced power to cut through large trees and manage even extensive storm damage. The tough, heavy duty, durable 46cc full-crank engine provides greater power, less vibration and longer equipment life. QuickStart technology, for easy to pull starting, gets you up and running instantly. The Remington Outlaw Gas Powered Chainsaw also features a premium 18" bar and low-kickback chain for all-around superior performance. Chain brake is inertia activated for safety while operating. Heavy Duty die-cast chassis and pro-grade components enhance durability while reducing the weight of the unit, and a 5-point Anti Vibration system, coupled with the cushioned wrap handle, reduces vibration and fatigue while increasing control and maneuverability, whether cutting through branches, slim or large trees. A robust side-mounted tensioning system saves time and ensures chain tension stays consistent, as chain adjustments are quickly made while working. The auto oiler system maintains the proper amount of lubricant on the chain, helps to keep the chain sharp, in addition to ensuring the saw cuts smoothly and safely. Tool less access to the spark plug and air filter provides quick and easy access to cleaning and replacement. Heavy Duty Storage/Carrying Case, 2-Cycle Oil and Chain Oil Included. Backed by a 2-year limited . With the RM4618 Outlaw 46cc 18” Chainsaw not only will you have quality lawn equipment that is reliable, easy-to-use, and powerful, but with Remington, you will have a Yard Well Done.
feature_bullets: HIGH OUTPUT ENGINE WITH 18-INCH BAR AND CHAIN: 46cc full crank 2 cycle engine provides greater power and less vibration. Premium 18-Inch bar and low-kickback chain cuts through even the toughest wood quickly and easily.
QUICKSTART TECHNOLOGY: Designed for quicker, smoother and easier pull starts allowing you to get to work right away on yard work, lawn care, and other projects.
DURABLE DIE-CAST CHASSIS: Lightweight, heavy duty and efficient. Engineered with pro-grade components to withstand the most brutal and prolonged cutting tasks.
AUTOMATIC OILER: Serves as the bar and chain's best friend as it keeps the proper amount of lubricant on the chain to ensure the saw cuts smoothly and safely.

COMFORTABLE USAGE: 5-point anti-vibration system and a cushioned full wrap handle makes this chainsaw more balanced, maneuverable and comfortable to operate. Maintain optimal comfortability and command during operation.
